meta.@content: Define an experimental new node to simply capture a single pose for an HAnimHumanoid model. Expected usage is to allow HAnimHumanoid to contain multiple Pose nodes which can be activated and composed.

This model also takes advantage of Inline/IMPORT capabilities (equivalent to USE node) and thus avoids fully copying a large, complex HAnimHumanoid model. Multiple HAnimHumanoid models have been tested satisfactorily, for HAnim version 1 (X3d 3) AND HAnim version 2 (X3D 4).
Holger Seelig for X_ITE, Sunrize on Windows, scripting guidance, and Inline IMPORT functionality as node-reference equivalent to USE
HAnim Architecture volume 1 version 2.1 draft, clause 6 Object interfaces, section 6.4 Pose
HAnim Architecture volume 1 version 2.1 draft, clause 4 Concepts, section 4.8.2 Modelling of human-like HAnim figures
HAnim Architecture volume 1 version 2.1 draft, clause 4 Concepts, section 4.8.3 Poses
earlier version of this prototype: originals/HAnimPosePreliminary.x3d

@info: Design to illustrate a potential HAnimPose node

-children.#comment: Multiple HAnimHumanoid Inline/IMPORT models are available to support testing: Characters/ JinLOA1 JinLOA2 JinLOA3 JinLOA4 ../Skin/JoeKick ../Skin/JoeSkeletonSkinSite ../Skin/BoxMan1 ../Skin/BoxMan2

Also tested satisfactorily: KoreanCharacter01Jin KoreanCharacter02Chul KoreanCharacter03Hyun KoreanCharacter04Young KoreanCharacter05Ju KoreanCharacter06Ga KoreanCharacter07No KoreanCharacter08Da KoreanCharacter09Ru KoreanCharacter10Mi KoreanCharacter11Min KoreanCharacter12Sun
Note that the following importedDEF must match the EXPORT name found in remote file

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo: Experimental node to assign joint values to a humanoid and assume a pose. Assumes that baseline HAnimHumanoid configuration must be I pose, which can be achieved by resetting every HAnimJoint to default values.

field.@appinfo: HAnimHumanoid for this Pose to act upon

-children.#comment: HAnimHumanoid initialization node goes here, this field is only used in the prototype implementation

field.@appinfo: name of this pose
joint values to apply to HAnimHumanoid

-children.#comment: initializating Joint nodes (if any) go here

field.@appinfo: explanation of purpose
default value true
default is no loa
how many seconds to achieve the pose
single Metadata* node
event indicating when pose transition is active
this event tells the HAnimPose node to fully transition, equivalent to set_fraction=1
reset the skeleton to I pose with all joints zeroed
allows transition to proceed incrementally from fraction [0..10
starts the animation clock
possible notification from LoadSensor if using HAnimHumanoid Inline/IMPORT AS/USE
debug trace to Browser output console this is a local prototype field

TimeSensor.@description: control timing of pose animation when triggered
control timing of skeleton reset to "A" pose when triggered

-children.#comment: no need to report isActive since that would be duplicative
interpolators generated by prototype script appear here at runtime
interpolators generated by prototype script appear here at runtime
